intro: Jonesiella asclepiadoides, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their toxic sap. The plant features narrow, fleshy leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink or white. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with deep roots and water-storing tissues. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain insect species.
